title: Bug: `internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creation`
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

`forge 0.2.0 (93ebcdd 2023-08-15T00:21:30.341654717Z)`

### What command(s) is the bug in?

`FOUNDRY_PROFILE=ci forge test --out forge-artifacts`

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

I get the following error if I execute the following command `FOUNDRY_PROFILE=ci forge test --out forge-artifacts`:

```bash
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  internal error: entered unreachable code: We should never have decoded calldata for contract creations
Location: crates/evm/src/trace/mod.rs:248

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

Backtrace omitted. Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display it.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.
Aborted
 ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 134.
```

My repository is private, unfortunately, and I'm not sure how I can share a repro best.
